snippet: Qutaiba al-Satem, implicated in a bombing, has become the face of what many Lebanese fear: citizens radicalized by the Syrian conflict. But in the village where he grew up, the picture is murkier.
abstract: Hnaider Journal; Qutaiba al-Satem, Lebanese man implicated in suicide bombing in Beirut, has become the face of what many Lebanese fear: citizens radicalized by the Syrian conflict; however, many villagers in his hometown of Hnaider, Lebanon, question whether Satem was actually guilty of the bombing, arguing he did not display any obvious signs of extremism before the attack.
lead_paragraph: Qutaiba al-Satem, implicated in a bombing, has become the face of what many Lebanese fear: citizens radicalized by the Syrian conflict. But in the village where he grew up, the picture is murkier.

headline.main: Lebanese Bomber’s Death, and Life, Leave Questions
headline.print_headline: Lebanese Bomber’s Death, and Life, Leave Questions
